description: From French manomètre, formed from Ancient Greek μανός (manós, “thin, rare”) + μέτρον (métron).

entries.meaning: An instrument to measure pressure in a fluid, especially a double-legged liquid column gauge used to measure the difference in the pressures of two fluids.
examples: As soon as the manometer of the pump indicated the maximum of rarification, the apparatus was inclined  […]
